<button type="button" class="collapsible">
Week 36: Introduction
</button>
<div class="content">

## Goals:

- Become familiar with the structure of the course

## Lecture and Discussion:

- Introduction to the structure of the course
- Questions and answers

## Lab:

- Participate in an onine experiment

## Assignment:

- Read Navarro, Foxcroft & Faulkenberry (2019)
  - Chapter 1
- Read chapters from Hinklelman & Kempthorne (2008)
  - Chapter 1 (Ok to skim some)
  - Chapter 2 (Ok to skim some, especially the math. I have highlighted key points)
</div>
<p></p><p></p>




<button type="button" class="collapsible">
Week 37: Introduction
</button>
<div class="content">

## Goals:

- Learn about operationalizing research questions

## Lecture and Discussion:

- Discuss the conceptual level (chapters from Hinklelman & Kempthorne, 2008; Navarro & Foxcroft, 2018)
- Lecture on operationalizing research questions
  - Justification
  - Operationalization
    - Participants (demographic data)
    - DV’s
    - IV’s
    - Possible confounds
    - Data types (Continous, Interval, etc.)
  - Experimental design
  - Analysis methods
    - Factors and levels
    - Correlational designs

## Lab:

- Tinker with OpenSesame

## Assignment:

- Read Navarro, Foxcroft & Faulkenberry (2019) Chapter 2

</div>
